intro: Cichorium endivia, commonly known as endive, is a leafy vegetable belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its curly, pale green leaves that are often harvested before they fully mature. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has a rosette-like structure. Its leaves contain a high concentration of inulin, a prebiotic fiber, and it is also rich in vitamins and minerals. Endive is often used in salads and can be found in both bitter and sweet varieties.
